justification: The paper states that "Two-stage decision-making tasks are designed to dissociate model-based and model-free response patterns," and the authors used a novel variant of this task to quantify model-based control.

In describing their paradigm the authors note that the task "replicating previous reports, participants expressed a mixture of model-based and model-free strategies," showing the task was used to index model-free control.
Under Self-report surveys the article says participants completed "measures of obsessive/compulsive behavior (OCI-R: Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory-Revised)."
The methods section reports that the survey set included "impulsivity (BIS: Barratt Impulsivity Scale)."
Participants completed the STAI, noted as "State-Trait Anxiety Inventory," to assess anxiety.
The authors list "depression (BDI: Beck's Depression Inventory)" among the questionnaires administered.
